subject: RE: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?
messageBody:
> Could he define the code smell "the code sucks" ?

One refactoring could improve the internal API: the rerun method is duplicated
in the AWT and Swing runners. Move this method to the BaseTestRunner.

The following refactorings are a natural consequence of the first one:

- move all run methods into the BaseTestRunner (so that every runners can run a
Test or a Class or a TestSuite)
- replace all the abstract methods (used to communicate with the AWT, Swing and
Text runners by a listener.
- hide the TestResult completely and only let clients communicate with the
listener.

And it looks very nice :-) Hopefully a future release will look nice too. I'm
working on it.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
